page.title: 01Alford and Montgarrie
page.content: The River Don runs from west to east through the centre of the area which includes parts of the three parishes of Tullynessle & Forbes, Keig and Alford. The villages of Alford and Montgarrie serve mainly the surrounding farming community though in recent years there has been an emphasis on developing tourism to provide more jobs locally. A popular attraction is Haughton House Country Park which has a caravan and camp site with picnic and play areas and woodland walks for day visitors. Winters are severe and the growing season short. The soil is generally fertile and the land mainly arable farmland. One tenth of the area is woodland, mainly birch.
